main event: A civilian observer reported seeing a bright silver star-like object across the Newburgh-Beacon Bridge in Newburgh, New York, on October 18, 1966.
interesting points: The observer described the object as being bright and compared its color to silver,The observation lasted for about 30 seconds,The observer had poor eyesight and was not wearing glasses during the sighting,It was concluded that the object may have been an aircraft, given the heavy air traffic in the area, There was no physical evidence or photographs associated with the sighting.
witness description: the observer was a civilian female, 53 years old, housewife with poor eyesight
